decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards, allowing for the resurrection of powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Silversmote Ghoul. It also uses cards like Cathartic Reunion and Tome Scour to facilitate this graveyard filling. The deck further takes advantage of the cards in the graveyard with Creeping Chill, which deals damage to the opponent when it is milled. The goal of the deck is to efficiently dredge through the library, constantly bringing back creatures and dealing damage to the opponent along the way.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on aggressive strategies and quick tempo. The key concept revolves around utilizing low-cost and efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler, alongside versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. Counterspells such as Spell Pierce and versatile card selection tools like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble help maintain control and disrupt opponents. The deck also includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Otawara, Soaring City for additional pressure. Overall, the deck aims to apply fast and relentless pressure while maintaining control over the game.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution to tutor and play specific creatures from the deck. These creatures serve as a toolbox, providing various effects such as gaining life (Scavenging Ooze), dealing damage (Blood Artist), recurring creatures (Sheoldred, the Apocalypse), and creating tokens (Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons). The deck also includes support cards like Wall of Roots and Birds of Paradise for mana acceleration, as well as Yawgmoth, Thran Physician for card draw and removal. Overall, the goal is to assemble the right combination of creatures to win the game.

The key concept of this deck revolves around utilizing the companion card Jegantha, the Wellspring in a combo-based strategy. The deck includes a mix of powerful planeswalkers, disruptive spells, and various combo pieces such as Agatha's Soul Cauldron, Mox Amber, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. The goal is to assemble various synergies and combo off with cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Jace, the Perfected Mind, potentially winning the game in a single turn. The deck also includes a solid mana base with various dual lands to support its strategy.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing the Cascade mechanic to cast Living End and cascade into powerful creatures. The deck includes cards like Architects of Will, Shardless Agent, and Violent Outburst to enable cascading. Additionally, the deck features cards like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves to further manipulate the deck and trigger additional abilities. The inclusion of Grief and Subtlety provides disruption and removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of powerful creatures while maintaining control and disruption.

The deck utilizes a combination of cards to quickly mill the opponent's library, aiming to win the game by forcing them to draw from an empty library. It includes cards like Archive Trap, Fractured Sanity, and Hedron Crab to mill large amounts of cards at once. It also incorporates disruption and card removal with Drown in the Loch and Surgical Extraction to hinder the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board state with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and is able to draw additional cards with Visions of Beyond.

This deck focuses on aggressively gaining and utilizing life through the Martyr of Sands ability and various lifegain spells. It also includes disruptive elements like Demolition Field and Skyclave Apparition to control the board and hinder the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to maintain a high life total while pressuring the opponent with efficient creatures like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Eagles of the North. It also has options for removal with cards like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of God to deal with threats. The deck's key concept revolves around combining aggressive play with life manipulation strategies.
